summary: Gaeton J. Fonzi is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are primarily payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents list Fonzi's name, position, salary, and pay period earnings within the context of the HSCA. While the specific role or contributions of Fonzi within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents, the records confirm his employment during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: The significance of Gaeton J. Fonzi lies in his employment with the HSCA, the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations. The documents confirm his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and impact of his work are not detailed in these records.
